meanings.definition: Relating to the force or energy of muscular contractions.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed an inotropic medication to strengthen the heart's contractions.
meanings.sent2: The inotropic effect of the drug increased the heart's pumping power.
meanings.sent3: The inotropic treatment made the heart muscle dance with renewed vigor.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as an inotropic force, boosting her determination.
meanings.sent5: The inotropic boost gave the heart muscle the strength of a superhero.

meanings.definition: Affecting the force or energy of muscular contractions.
meanings.sent1: The inotropic properties of the supplement enhanced muscle performance.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's diet included foods known for their inotropic effects on muscles.
meanings.sent3: The inotropic drink promised to turn even the laziest muscles into energetic dynamos.
meanings.sent4: His words had an inotropic impact on her motivation, making her feel invincible.
meanings.sent5: The inotropic influence of music on movement is undeniable.
